===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|へみ}}
{{IPAchar|/pemi/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɸemi/}} → {{IPAchar|/hemi/}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=へみ}}. The older form of modern ''hebi'' below.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Possibly cognate with {{cog|ko|뱀||snake}}.

Possibly related to, or influenced by, {{etyl|ojp|-}}-derived verb {{m|ja|食む|tr=hamu||to bite}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|へみ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|へみ}}

# {{lb|ja|obsolete|sort=へみ}} [[snake]]

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|へび}}
{{IPAchar|/hemi/}} → {{IPAchar|/hebi/}}

From earlier ''hemi''.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref> The medial {{IPAchar|/m/}} lost its nasal quality to become a [[plosive]].

{{ja-pron|yomi=k|へび|acc=1|acc_ref=NHK,DJR,SMK5}}

====Noun====

# [[snake]], [[serpent]]
